author: Madurai Bureau
text:
Christians took out processions holding palm fronds in different parts of Ramanathapuram and Sivaganga districts on Palm Sunday.

Hundreds of Christians, young and old, participated in the processions, singing hymns marking the beginning of the holy week and in commemoration of the entry of Jesus into Jerusalem, ahead of his crucifixion on ‘Good Friday’.

Christians who were on 40 days lent since Ash Wednesday on February 10 to prepare for Easter with penance and prayer, offered special prayers in churches after taking out the processions.

Christians took part in large numbers in Church of South India (CSI) and Our Lady of Rosary Church here, Our Lady of Voyage Church in Thondi, Arulanandar Church in Oriyur and Sacred Heart Shrine in Idaikattur in Sivaganga district.

Special services were held in catholic and protestant churches in the two districts. Priests blessed and distributed palm fronds to the church members. Children were seen carrying cross made of palm fronds.

Dindigul

Hundreds of Christians took out Palm Sunday processions in Dindigul. The participants carried palm fronds in their hands.

Similar processions were jointly organised by the CSI and the RC Christians in various parts of the district. Palm Sunday Holy Masses were also organised in churches.
title: Palm Sunday processions
